articles.headline: Kenneth Fisher Ruled Investing. Then He Made a Sexist Joke.
articles.snippet: Mr. Fisher compared the wooing of wealthy clients to “trying to get into a girl’s pants.” Investment funds have since pulled nearly $2 billion from his firm.
articles.abstract: Mr. Fisher compared the wooing of wealthy clients to “trying to get into a girl’s pants.” Investment funds have since pulled nearly $2 billion from his firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kenneth Fisher, a billionaire money manager, is known for aggressively marketing his firm and attaching his name to books, columns and TV ads.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Matt Phillips

articles.headline: One Family Built Forever 21, and Fueled Its Collapse
articles.snippet: The retailer’s bankruptcy filing, and interviews with former employees, give a rare glimpse into a family controlled, intensely secretive operation.
articles.abstract: The retailer’s bankruptcy filing, and interviews with former employees, give a rare glimpse into a family controlled, intensely secretive operation.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Forever 21 filed for bankruptcy last month, the fast fashion chain described its history in documents that read, at times, like a pitch for a memoir or a Netflix special.

articles.headline: Republicans Grind Impeachment Inquiry to Halt as Evidence Mounts Against Trump
articles.snippet: House Republicans staged a protest in the secure suite on Capitol Hill where the impeachment inquiry is proceeding, seeking to shift the focus away from damaging revelations about the president.
articles.abstract: House Republicans staged a protest in the secure suite on Capitol Hill where the impeachment inquiry is proceeding, seeking to shift the focus away from damaging revelations about the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republicans ground the impeachment inquiry to a halt for hours on Wednesday, staging a protest at the Capitol that sowed chaos and delayed a crucial deposition as they sought to deflect the spotlight from the revelations the investigation has unearthed about President Trump.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Trump’s War on the ‘Deep State’ Turns Against Him
articles.snippet: The impeachment inquiry is in some ways the culmination of a battle between the president and the government institutions he distrusted and disparaged.
articles.abstract: The impeachment inquiry is in some ways the culmination of a battle between the president and the government institutions he distrusted and disparaged.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Nameless, faceless and voiceless, the C.I.A. officer who first triggered the greatest threat to President Trump’s tenure in office seemed to be practically the embodiment of the “deep state” that the president has long accused of trying to take him down.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Lara Jakes, Julian E. Barnes, Sharon LaFraniere and Edward Wong

articles.headline: The Student Vote Is Surging. So Are Efforts to Suppress It.
articles.snippet: The share of college students casting ballots doubled from 2014 to 2018, a potential boon to Democrats. But in Texas and elsewhere, Republicans are erecting roadblocks to the polls.
articles.abstract: The share of college students casting ballots doubled from 2014 to 2018, a potential boon to Democrats. But in Texas and elsewhere, Republicans are erecting roadblocks to the polls.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Texas — At Austin Community College, civics is an unwritten part of the curriculum — so much so that for years the school has tapped its own funds to set up temporary early-voting sites on nine of its 11 campuses.

articles.headline: A French Wine From China? This $300 Bottle Is the Real Thing
articles.snippet: A Rothschild estate in Shandong Province has released its first vintage. It was 10 years in the making.
articles.abstract: A Rothschild estate in Shandong Province has released its first vintage. It was 10 years in the making.
articles.lead_paragraph: PENGLAI, China — In China, the stories about Château Lafite Rothschild are as notorious as the Bordeaux wine estate is legendary.

articles.headline: The Cost of Trump’s Aid Freeze in the Trenches of Ukraine’s War
articles.snippet: As President Trump froze military aid to Ukraine and urged it to investigate his rivals, the country was struggling in a bare-bones fight against Russian-backed separatists.
articles.abstract: As President Trump froze military aid to Ukraine and urged it to investigate his rivals, the country was struggling in a bare-bones fight against Russian-backed separatists.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZOLOTE, Ukraine — Lt. Ivan Molchanets peeked over a parapet of sand bags at the front line of the war in Ukraine. Next to him was an empty helmet propped up to trick snipers, already perforated with multiple holes.

articles.headline: As Putin Era Begins to Wane, Russia Unleashes a Sweeping Crackdown
articles.snippet: A wave of arrests against journalists, opposition activists, doctors and religious believers raises a question: Is this a police state in the making or just a highly dysfunctional one?
articles.abstract: A wave of arrests against journalists, opposition activists, doctors and religious believers raises a question: Is this a police state in the making or just a highly dysfunctional one?
articles.lead_paragraph: PSKOV, Russia — After a teenager blew himself up inside a branch of Russia’s secret police near the Arctic Circle late last year, a freelance journalist hundreds of miles to the south drew what she thought was “an obvious and banal” conclusion in her weekly radio commentary.
